title: Category Sort
description: Can you spot the odd one out? Given a group of items, identify which one does NOT belong to the same category!

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a fruit?
questions.explanation: Celery is a vegetable, while apple, banana, and grape are all fruits.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a planet in our solar system?
questions.explanation: Polaris is a star (the North Star), while Mars, Jupiter, and Saturn are all planets.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a string instrument?
questions.explanation: Trumpet is a brass instrument, while violin, cello, and harp are all string instruments.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a mammal?
questions.explanation: Eagle is a bird, while dolphin, elephant, and whale are all mammals.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a primary color in painting?
questions.explanation: Green is a secondary color (made by mixing blue and yellow). The primary colors in painting are red, blue, and yellow.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a country in South America?
questions.explanation: Portugal is in Europe, while Brazil, Argentina, and Colombia are all in South America.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a type of pasta?
questions.explanation: Focaccia is a type of flatbread, while penne, rigatoni, and farfalle are all pasta shapes.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT an ocean?
questions.explanation: The Mediterranean is a sea, not an ocean. The Atlantic, Pacific, and Indian are three of the world's oceans.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a woodwind instrument?
questions.explanation: Trombone is a brass instrument, while flute, clarinet, and oboe are all woodwind instruments.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a bone in the human body?
questions.explanation: Biceps is a muscle, while femur, tibia, and fibula are all bones in the leg.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a noble gas?
questions.explanation: Nitrogen is not a noble gas. Neon, argon, and helium are all noble gases found in Group 18 of the periodic table.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a Baltic state?
questions.explanation: Romania is in southeastern Europe, not the Baltics. Latvia, Lithuania, and Estonia are the three Baltic states.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a percussion instrument?
questions.explanation: Bassoon is a woodwind instrument, while xylophone, timpani, and snare drum are all percussion instruments.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a type of cloud?
questions.explanation: Solstice is an astronomical event (the longest or shortest day of the year), not a cloud type. Cumulus, stratus, and cirrus are all cloud types.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a Shakespeare play?
questions.explanation: Candide is a novella by Voltaire, not a Shakespeare play. Macbeth, Othello, and Hamlet are all plays by William Shakespeare.
